channel.title: Bem Bom – Chow Down Orlando
channel.description: Exploring all that Orlando has to offer.

item.title: Bem Bom
item.dc:creator: justincox
item.description:

It’s topped with a bunch of amazing stuff, including a Bem Bom specialty sauce, and packed […]

The post Bem Bom appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.
item.content:encoded:
We’ve covered Bem Bom before, but what is not to love with their Portuguese inspired favorites?

Pictured at the top left is the Prego de Porco, which is a 12-hour braised pork that literally just melts in your mouth. It’s topped with a bunch of amazing stuff, including a Bem Bom specialty sauce, and packed between a Portuguese roll – kind of like a softer ciabatta. It is an amazing sandwich.

At the top right was a special of the day, a lamb burger with a homemade tomato marmalade, feta cheese, and a bunch of other good stuff. It was served with the same great Portuguese roll.

Finally, the other special of the day, were the fries cooked in truffle oil and seasoned with rosemary and 24-month aged parmesan cheese. To say these were amazing would be an understatement.

If you haven’t eaten at Bem Bom (Portuguese for “good good”) then find them tonight.

The post Bem Bom appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.

item.title: Bem Bom
item.dc:creator: justincox
item.description:
This is the mango painted fish tacos from the Bem Bom truck. When I was reading the menu board, I saw “mango painted fish” and stopped reading. I ordered it without really paying attention to the rest of the description, or the menu for that matter. In fact, I didn’t even realize they were tacos […]

The post Bem Bom appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.
item.content:encoded:
This is the mango painted fish tacos from the Bem Bom truck. When I was reading the menu board, I saw “mango painted fish” and stopped reading. I ordered it without really paying attention to the rest of the description, or the menu for that matter. In fact, I didn’t even realize they were tacos until they arrived. But man, they were good. Bem Bom’s homemade mango habanero vinaigrette pained over a nice white fish, with all the toppings. It provides a nice sweet flavor and then, as you’re swallowing, a nice kick from the habanero. I also went with the nata, egg custard also pictured. It was a nice dessert to close with.

Bem Bom is Portuguese for “good good” and that’s just what their food is.

You can follow Bem Bom on Twitter

The post Bem Bom appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.
